1) supply chains for raw materials are still immature (read more expensive/ imported)

2) labor is limited and has very specific rules (it’s communist and small)

3) energy is less abundant 

4) ports and transport are slower

Banh mi thit nuong, grilled pork sandwiches served on crusty baguettes with fresh herbs, pickled vegetables, and spicy chili sauce, are a favorite street food in Vietnam.
Bun mang vit, a duck and bamboo shoot noodle soup flavored with ginger, lemongrass, and herbs, is a specialty of northern Vietnam.
Banh bao vac, translucent dumplings made with rice flour and filled with shrimp and pork, are a specialty of Hanoi.
Banh Mi is a Vietnamese sandwich that combines French baguettes with local fillings like pickled vegetables, herbs, meats, and pate.
Banh cuon, delicate rice flour crepes filled with ground pork, mushrooms, and shallots, are a popular breakfast dish in northern Vietnam.
Bun mang vit, a duck and bamboo shoot noodle soup flavored with ginger, lemongrass, and herbs, is a specialty of northern Vietnam.
Banh mi, a crusty baguette filled with savory meats, fresh herbs, and pickled vegetables, is another beloved Vietnamese dish that reflects the country''s French colonial history.
Banh bot chien, crispy fried rice cakes stir-fried with eggs, shrimp, and green onions, is a popular street food in southern Vietnam.
